Diabetic peripheral neuropathy ( DPN ) is one of the most common complications of chronic diabetes mellitus .Pathological characteristics of DPN include axonal atrophy , nerve demyelination , and delayed regeneration of peripheral sensory nerve fibers .The goal of treatment in DPN is not only to ameliorate neurological symptoms but also to slow or reverse the underlying neurodegenerative process .
